mitre_attack_techniques.signature_description: Detected one or more anomalous HTTP requests
Detected HTTP requests to some non white-listed domains
Some process has originated direct HTTPS traffic with one or more hosts.
Network activity detected but not expressed in API logs
Executes commands using a shell command-line interpreter
Executes the "systemctl" command used for controlling the systemd system and service manager
Sample and/or dropped files symbols with suspicious names
Creates hidden files, links and/or directories
Uses the "uname" system call to query kernel version information (possible evasion)
Detected TCP or UDP traffic on non-standard ports

signature_matches.description: All HTTP servers contacted by the sample do not answer. The sample is likely an old dropper which does no longer work.
Contains symbols with names commonly found in malware
Connects to IPs without corresponding DNS lookups
Uses the "uname" system call to query kernel version information (possible evasion)
Executes commands using a shell command-line interpreter
Executes the "systemctl" command used for controlling the systemd system and service manager
Tries to connect to HTTP servers, but all servers are down (expired dropper behavior)
Sample and/or dropped files contains symbols with file path information
Detected TCP or UDP traffic on non-standard ports
Sample and/or dropped files contains symbols with suspicious names
